titleStmt.title: Comonwealth of Kentucky v. Wright & Nevill, Judgment
CWG11344

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Marion Circuit Court
May Term 1862.
May 31st 1862,
Commonwealth Plff
against } for an affray
Wright & Nevill Defts

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendents entered plea of not guilty and thereupon came a Jury towit: Redmind Prewett Frank Ford H Johnson John Beaven Ben Wheatly Felix McAtee James A Jarboe Joseph Watson James Avritt Leo Beaven Q M Chandler C A Vancleave were Sworn to try the issue and after trying hearing the evidence retired and returned into court the following verdict towit: We of the jury find the Defendants both guilty of an affray so charged in the within indictment and assess the fine of Wright to forty five dollars and Nevill to Thirty dollars James A Jarboe one of the jury It is therefore adjudged that Said Wright make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of forty five dollars and that said Neville make his fine to the commonwealth by the payment of thirty dollars the amounts by the jury in their verdict aforesaid assessed and also the costs herein expended and that they may be taken &c
Copy att N T Berry Ck
